intro: Crantzia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored crantzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, and it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. Crantzia bicolor is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in native gardens.
